etymology.description: 禾(禾) (hé, 'grain') + 瓮(瓮) (wèng, 'jar') = Phonetic component
etymology.interpretation: The character 㚇 (zōng) is primarily used as a phonetic component in other characters. It combines 禾(禾) (hé, 'grain') for its semantic value with 瓮(瓮) (wèng, 'jar') for its phonetic influence, but it is not commonly used on its own in modern Chinese.
